translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sal-tree Blossoms

analyzed: sayam paṭibhā niyat thera a padāna  kakudham vilasantava  devadevam narāsabha
translated: The Elder Sayampaṭibhāṇiya’s Birth Story🔽Like a resplendent crest-jewel,
the god of gods, the bull among men,🔽as he goes on the road,

original: ko disvā na pasīdati.🔽Tamandhakāraṁ nāsetvā,🔽santāretvā bahuṁ janaṁ;
analyzed: kaḥ disvā na pasīdati  tam andhakāram na āsetvā  santāretvā bahum jana
translated: who, seeing him, would not be confident?🔽Having dispelled the darkness,🔽having saved many people,
shining with the light of knowledge,

analyzed: kaḥ disvā na pasīdati  vasī sata sahassehi  nīyantam loka nāyaka
translated: who, seeing him, would not be confident?🔽The leader of the world,🔽being led by a hundred thousand powerful men,
lifting up many beings,

original: ko disvā na pasīdati.🔽Āhanantaṁ dhammabheriṁ,🔽maddantaṁ titthiye gaṇe;
analyzed: kaḥ disvā na pasīdati  āhanantam dhamma bheri  mad dantam titthiye gaṇe
translated: who, seeing him, would not be confident?🔽Sounding the drum of the Dhamma,🔽crushing the groups of sectarians,
roaring the lion’s roar,
who, seeing him, would not be confident?
As far as the world of Brahmā,
having come with the Brahmās,
they ask subtle questions,
who, seeing him, would not be confident?
Having made reverential salutation to him,
the gods come to him,
and they experience merit,
who, seeing him, would not be confident?

original: Sabbe janā samāgantvā,🔽sampavārenti cakkhumaṁ;🔽Na vikampati ajjhiṭṭho,
analyzed: sabbe janā samāgantvā  sampavārenti cakkhuma  na vikampati ajjhiṭṭhaḥ
translated: All the people having come together,🔽they question the one with vision,🔽he is unshaken when pressed,
who, seeing him, would not be confident?

analyzed: nagaram pavisataḥ yassa  ravanti bheriyaḥ bahū
translated: When he enters the city🔽many drums are beaten,
and the intoxicated elephants trumpet;
who, seeing this, would not be confident?
When he walks along the street
all the lights are eclipsed;
the high ones become level;
who, seeing this, would not be confident?
When the Buddha speaks
the sound is heard even beyond the world-sphere;
it makes known all beings;
who, hearing this, would not be confident?
For a hundred thousand eons

analyzed: yam buddham abhikittayi  duggatim na abhijānāmi
translated: I praised the Buddha;🔽I do not know of any bad destination;
this is the fruit of my praise.
My defilements are burned up,
I dwell without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Sayampaṭibhāni recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sayampaṭibhāniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Sayampaṭibhāniyattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sayampaṭibhāniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽sayampaṭibhāniya therassa apadānam navama
translated: The elder Sayampaṭibhāni’s account is the ninth.
